pageContent: Prostate cancer continues to affect an increasing number of men in the United States. When diagnosed, these men may not have access to information that differentiates the long-term outcomes of one method of treatment from another. This study evaluated the impact of external beam radiation on several domains of quality of life, including physical, social/family, emotional, and functional well-being domains.

metaData.source:
Gene-environment interactions between JAZF1 and occupational and household lead exposure in prostate cancer among African American men
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/24801046/
